alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Muscogee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 05 at 3:15PM EDT until April 05 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Chattahoochee County in west central Georgia... Muscogee County in west central Georgia... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Columbus, North Fort Benning, Upatoi, Bibb City, Fort Benning/lawson Army Air Fld, Vista Terrace, Kenwood, Flat Rock, Sand Hill, Edgewood, Saint Marys Hills, Highland Park, Columbus Metropolitan Airport, Benning Hills, Benning Park, Midland, Custer Road Terrace, Avondale, Eelbeck/West Fort Benning and Carter Acres. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
